name: Bran Castle
description: Often referred to as Dracula's Castle, this medieval fortress offers stunning views of the Carpathian Mountains and a rich history of Romanian royalty.

name: Peleș Castle
description: A stunning Neo-Renaissance castle nestled in the Carpathians, known for its exquisite architecture and beautiful interior.

name: Transfăgărășan Highway
description: Dubbed the best road in the world, it offers breathtaking mountain views and winding roads through the Făgăraș Mountains.

name: Sighișoara Citadel
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this well-preserved medieval town is the birthplace of Vlad the Impaler and features colorful houses and cobblestone streets.

name: Danube Delta
description: One of Europe's last wild areas, it boasts rich biodiversity and is a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve, perfect for birdwatching and boat tours.

name: Bucovina Painted Monasteries
description: Famous for their exterior frescoes, these UNESCO World Heritage Sites offer a glimpse into Romania's rich religious art and history.

name: Corvin Castle
description: A stunning Gothic-Renaissance castle, known for its impressive towers and rich history, believed to have been home to Vlad the Impaler.

name: The Merry Cemetery
description: Famous for its colorful tombstones with humorous epitaphs, this cemetery offers a unique perspective on life and death in Romanian culture.

name: The Salt Mine of Turda
description: An underground amusement park and salt mine, it features a Ferris wheel, mini-golf, and a boat ride on an underground lake.

name: The Bigar Waterfall
description: Known for its unique appearance, this waterfall resembles a giant green sponge and is often considered one of the most beautiful in the world.

name: Biertan Fortified Church
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this fortified church is a stunning example of Transylvanian architecture and offers insights into medieval life.

name: Hoia Forest
description: Known as Romania's most haunted forest, it attracts visitors with its eerie legends and unique natural beauty.

name: Transylvania's Saxon Villages
description: These picturesque villages, with their fortified churches and traditional houses, showcase the rich cultural heritage of the Saxons in Romania.

name: The Carpathian Mountains
description: A stunning mountain range that offers numerous hiking trails, picturesque landscapes, and opportunities for winter sports.

name: Maramureș Wooden Churches
description: Famous for their tall wooden spires, these churches are UNESCO World Heritage Sites that reflect the region's unique architectural tradition.

name: The Black Sea Coast
description: Known for its beautiful beaches and vibrant nightlife, the Black Sea Coast is a popular destination for sun-seekers and party-goers.

name: The Transylvania International Film Festival
description: Romania's largest film festival, it showcases both local and international films, attracting filmmakers and cinephiles from around the world.

name: The Iron Gates
description: A stunning gorge along the Danube River, offering breathtaking views and opportunities for hiking and boat trips.

name: The Village Museum
description: An open-air museum showcasing traditional Romanian village life with authentic houses and artifacts from different regions.

name: Făgăraș Fortress
description: A well-preserved medieval fortress with a rich history, offering insights into the region's past and stunning views from its towers.

name: Retezat National Park
description: Known for its stunning mountain landscapes, glacial lakes, and diverse wildlife, it's a paradise for hikers and nature lovers.

name: The Palace of the Parliament
description: The second-largest administrative building in the world, it showcases Romania's communist-era architecture and offers guided tours.

name: The National Museum of Art of Romania
description: Housed in the former Royal Palace, the museum features an impressive collection of Romanian and European art.

name: The Dacian Fortresses of the Orăștie Mountains
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, these ancient fortresses offer a glimpse into the lives of the Dacians and their impressive defensive structures.

name: Băile Herculane
description: A historic spa town known for its thermal waters and beautiful architecture, perfect for relaxation and wellness.

name: The Transylvanian Alps
description: A breathtaking mountain range that offers stunning landscapes, hiking, and opportunities for winter sports.

name: Cascada Bigăr
description: Famous for its unique shape and picturesque setting, this waterfall is a hidden gem in Romania's natural landscape.

name: The Old City of Bucharest
description: Known for its vibrant nightlife, historic architecture, and charming streets, it's a hub of culture and entertainment.

name: The Piatra Craiului National Park
description: Renowned for its dramatic limestone ridges, this park offers exceptional hiking opportunities and rich biodiversity.

name: The Răchițele Waterfall
description: A stunning waterfall set in a picturesque landscape, it's a perfect spot for a day trip and nature photography.

name: The Citadel of Alba Iulia
description: A historic star-shaped fortress that played a vital role in Romania's history, now a popular tourist site with museums and events.

name: The Painted Hills of Buzău
description: Known for their unique geological formations and vibrant colors, these hills are a hidden natural treasure.

name: The Fortress of Poenari
description: A ruined fortress often associated with Vlad the Impaler, it offers stunning views and a challenging hike to reach.

name: The Seven Ladders Canyon
description: A breathtaking canyon with wooden ladders and waterfalls, perfect for adventurous hikers.

name: The Turda Gorge
description: A stunning natural reserve known for its dramatic cliffs and diverse flora and fauna, ideal for hiking and climbing.

name: The Memorial of the Victims of Communism and of the Resistance
description: A poignant museum documenting Romania's communist past and the struggles of those who resisted it.

name: The Sphinx and Babele
description: Unique rock formations in the Bucegi Mountains, steeped in legends and offering stunning panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

name: The Caves of Scărișoara
description: Home to one of the largest underground glaciers in the world, this cave system is a fascinating natural wonder.

name: The Fortress of Râșnov
description: A medieval fortress with panoramic views of the surrounding area and rich historical significance.

name: The Iron Gates Natural Park
description: A picturesque natural reserve along the Danube, known for its stunning landscapes and rich biodiversity.

name: The Hoia Forest
description: Often referred to as the world's most haunted forest, it is not only mysterious but also a beautiful natural area for hiking.
